excerpt: Oval plaza on site of Roman amphitheater, ringed by medieval houses, now home to cafes & a market.
detail_description: Piazza dell'Anfiteatro is a vibrant oval plaza located in Lucca, Italy, built on the site of an ancient Roman amphitheater. Surrounded by medieval houses, it now hosts charming cafes and a bustling market. The square's elliptical shape is a result of the original amphitheater's imposing structure. Throughout history, it has been a central meeting point and played a significant role in city life and politics.
name: Piazza dell'Anfiteatro
address: 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Grand 17th-century palazzo hotel with a refined room & apartments, plus a baroque garden.
detail_description: Palazzo Pfanner is a grand 17th-century palazzo hotel featuring elegant rooms and apartments, along with a baroque garden. It's one of the must-see attractions in Lucca, Italy. The city offers various cultural highlights such as the National Museum of Villa Guinigi and Palazzo Pfanner. Visitors can also explore local craftsmanship and find unique gifts in charming stores.
name: Palazzo Pfanner
address: Via degli Asili, 33, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Art-filled Romanesque church with a golden mosaic facade, plus an ornate 12th-century font.
detail_description: Basilica di San Frediano is a Romanesque church in Lucca, Italy, known for its golden mosaic facade and ornate 12th-century font. The city of Lucca offers a rich historical experience with well-preserved medieval walls, piazzas, and stately buildings like the Duomo di San Martino and Basilica di San Frediano.
name: Basilica di San Frediano
address: Piazza S. Frediano, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Clock tower from 1390, linked to a legend about the devil, with a staircase to views over rooftops.
detail_description: The Torre delle Ore, a medieval clock tower in Lucca, dates back to 1390 and is shrouded in legend. It boasts a functioning mechanical clock from the 17th century and offers panoramic views of the city's rooftops from its staircase. The tallest tower in Lucca, it was originally built for timekeeping with its clock and bells.
name: Torre delle Ore
address: Via Fillungo, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Lucca is a city on the Serchio river in Italy’s Tuscany region. It’s known for the well-preserved Renaissance walls encircling its historic city center and its cobblestone streets. Broad, tree-lined pathways along the tops of these massive 16th- and 17th-century ramparts are popular for strolling and cycling. Casa di Puccini, where the great opera composer was born, is now a house museum.
detail_description: Lucca, a charming city in Tuscany, Italy, is famous for its well-preserved Renaissance walls surrounding the historic center and its picturesque cobblestone streets. Visitors can enjoy leisurely walks or bike rides along the broad pathways atop these ancient ramparts. The city also boasts Casa di Puccini, the birthplace of the renowned opera composer turned house museum.
name: Lucca
address: 55100 Province of Lucca, Italy

excerpt: Brick tower from 14th century; climb 230 steps to its oak-topped summit for mountain & city views.
detail_description: Guinigi Tower is a 14th-century brick tower in Lucca, Italy. Visitors can climb 230 steps to reach the top, which is adorned with oak trees and offers stunning views of the city and surrounding mountains. The tower also houses the National Museum of Villa Guinigi, showcasing an extensive collection of art from both local and foreign artists who worked for ecclesiastical and secular clients in Lucca.
name: Guinigi Tower
address: Via Guinigi, 29, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Striking 1100s church with wedding cake-like carved facade, known for its panel painting by Lippi.
detail_description: Chiesa di San Michele in Foro is a remarkable 11th-century church in Lucca, known for its intricately carved facade resembling a wedding cake and featuring a panel painting by Lippi. The city of Lucca offers various attractions such as Piazza Napoleone, Domus Romana Archaeological Site, Clock Tower, and more. Visitors can also explore the local culture, dining options, shopping spots, and nightlife.
name: Chiesa di San Michele in Foro
address: P.za San Michele, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Historic, narrow street with many significant structures, a clock tower & walking tours.
detail_description: Via Fillungo is a historic and narrow street that cuts through the old town, featuring significant structures and a clock tower. It is known for its high-end boutiques and luxurious labels, as well as hidden stores and local workshops offering unique handcrafted items. The adjacent Piazza dell'Anfiteatro is considered one of the most beautiful in Italy due to its characteristic closed square appearance with small doors and vaults.
name: Via Fillungo
address: 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Giacomo Puccini museum displaying furniture, letters & other artifacts in the composer's birthplace.
detail_description: The Puccini Museum, situated in Lucca, is a tribute to the renowned composer Giacomo Puccini. Housed in the very place where he was born and spent his formative years, the museum offers an intimate look into his life and work.
name: Puccini Museum
address: Corte S. Lorenzo, 9, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Bustling town square bordered by a 1500s Ducal Palace, shops and cafes and hosting summer concerts.
detail_description: Piazza Napoleone is a charming open area situated near Piazza dell Anfiteatro in the historic center of Lucca. It is home to significant structures such as the Ducale Palace, known for its striking front facade. The square also boasts an elegant white statue of Maria Luisa, surrounded by lush trees on three sides, creating a picturesque setting for visitors to enjoy.
name: Piazza Napoleone
address: P.za Napoleone, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: 16th-century baroque-style palace displaying its original frescoes, furnishings & tapestries.
detail_description: The Museo Nazionale di Palazzo Mansi is a 16th-century baroque-style palace that showcases its original frescoes, furnishings, and tapestries. It is the museum of the city and its territory, exhibiting a rich collection of artworks produced for Lucca by local or foreign artists.
name: Museo Nazionale di Palazzo Mansi
address: V. Galli Tassi, 43, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: P.za San Michele is a charming square located in the heart of Italy. It is known for its picturesque surroundings, historic architecture, and vibrant atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls around the square, taking in the beautiful sights and immersing themselves in the local culture. The area is also home to quaint cafes and shops, perfect for indulging in some authentic Italian cuisine or picking up unique souvenirs.
name: P.za San Michele
address: 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: 11th-century place of worship with a square bell tower, carved medieval crucifix & treasury museum.
detail_description: The Duomo di San Martino is an 11th-century place of worship in Lucca, Italy. It features a square bell tower, a carved medieval crucifix, and a treasury museum. The cathedral is one of the city's historical landmarks, along with well-preserved medieval walls and stately buildings like the Basilica of San Frediano. Visitors can also explore cultural highlights such as the Palazzo Pfanner and the National Museum of Villa Guinigi.
name: Duomo di San Martino
address: Piazza Antelminelli, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Glamorous restored villa on the site of an ancient fortress, with noteworthy architecture & gardens.
detail_description: Villa Reale di Marlia is a stunning historical landmark just north of Lucca, Italy. The villa boasts unique architecture and is surrounded by over 16 hectares of meticulously maintained gardens from different eras. Visitors can explore the lush grounds, which include camellia walkways, an Art Deco-style garden, a lake, and an open-air green theatre.
name: Villa Reale di Marlia
address: Via Fraga Alta, 2, 55014 Marlia LU, Italy

excerpt: Bustling town square bordered by a 1500s Ducal Palace, shops and cafes and hosting summer concerts.
detail_description: Piazza Napoleone, also known as Piazza Grande, is a bustling town square in Lucca, Italy. It is bordered by the 1500s Ducal Palace and features a variety of shops and cafes. The square holds historical significance as the center of political power in Lucca and has been a venue for summer concerts.
name: Piazza Napoleone
address: P.za Napoleone, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Botanical garden opened in 1820, with a pond & bog, greenhouses for tropical plants & an arboretum.
detail_description: Orto Botanico Comunale di Lucca, established in 1820, is a charming botanical garden featuring a pond, bog, greenhouses for tropical plants, and an arboretum. Initially commissioned by Elisa Bonaparte, the garden now houses around two hundred plant species including azaleas, camellias, and rhododendrons.
name: Orto Botanico Comunale di Lucca
address: Casermetta San Regolo, Baluardo San Regolo, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Historic walls built to protect the city, now used as foot & bicycle paths with expansive vistas.
detail_description: Mura di Lucca, also known as Lucca City Walls, encircle the historic center of Lucca, Italy. These Renaissance-era fortifications have been repurposed into a scenic pedestrian promenade and bicycle path adorned with gardens and panoramic viewpoints. The gates of the walls, some dating back to the 16th century, offer entry points into the city and provide a glimpse into its historical security framework.
name: Mura di Lucca
address: Porta san Donato, Via delle Mura Urbane, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Large, 15th-century palace-turned-events-venue, with many statues & a central court.
detail_description: Palazzo Ducale di Lucca, also known as Palazzo Pubblico, is a grand 15th-century palace located in the historical center of Lucca. Overlooking one side of Piazza Napoleone, it has served as the seat of government and witnessed significant historical events. The palace houses Museo del Risorgimento, featuring artifacts related to Italian unification and a remarkable armory with weapons from various periods.
name: Palazzo Ducale di Lucca
address: Cortile Carrara, 1, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: The Domus Romana Lucca is a fascinating history museum that offers insight into the rich archaeological finds and the 2000-year history of Lucca. The museum provides an informative introductory video, followed by a guided tour showcasing Roman archeology, a Roman map, architectonic elements, and various archaeological objects found on-site. Despite being covered up by later construction, this historical gem in the heart of Lucca has been brought back to light through private initiatives.
name: Domus Romana Lucca | Museo Archeologico a Lucca
address: Via Cesare Battisti, 15, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Villa Bottini is a serene oasis in Lucca, offering a perfect setting for a leisurely stroll or a romantic evening. The villa hosts summer cinema events under the stars, creating an enchanting atmosphere with the gentle breeze. It's known for its peaceful ambiance and beautiful garden, making it an ideal spot to unwind and enjoy outdoor movie screenings during the summer months.
name: Villa Bottini
address: Via Elisa, 9, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Piazza Anfiteatro is a must-visit destination in Lucca, Italy. This unique square stands out for its beautiful architecture and the way the buildings are arranged in a closed circle, showcasing the ancient circular footprint of the old amphitheater. It's considered one of the most stunning squares in Italy and offers visitors a glimpse into history through its distinctive layout.
name: Piazza Anfiteatro
address: 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Handmade pasta & regional dishes in a long-standing, cozy trattoria with brassware displays.
detail_description: Buca di Sant'Antonio is a long-standing trattoria located in the historical center of Lucca, Italy. The restaurant offers a cozy and welcoming ambiance with traditional Tuscan rural accents. It is known for serving excellent regional dishes, including mouth-watering meat and daily fresh handmade pasta. The wide wine list complements the authentic Italian cuisine. Visitors can enjoy dining indoors or on the romantic patio during warmer seasons.
name: Buca di Sant'Antonio
address: Via della Cervia, 3, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Acquedotto Nottolini, a 19th-century neoclassical aqueduct located just outside Lucca, played a crucial role in supplying water to the town through its stone channel supported by over 400 arches. The landmark stretches for more than three kilometers and was originally conceptualized in the early 1700s but was completed much later. Visitors can take a scenic walk or bike ride along this historic structure, which collected water from mountain springs south of Lucca.
name: Acquedotto Nottolini
address: Via Tempietto, 388, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: In the charming town of Lucca, visitors can explore the Tempietto Volto Santo, a small Renaissance temple in the Cathedral of San Martino that houses the legendary wooden crucifix known as the Holy Face. This ancient artifact, dating back to the 9th century, is believed to be an acheropita image and has been revered throughout Europe since medieval times.
name: Tempietto Volto Santo
address: Piazza Antelminelli, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: The Museo Nazionale di Villa Guinigi in Lucca is a treasure trove of art and history, showcasing the city's rich heritage. Housed in the country residence of Paolo Guinigi, lord of Lucca from 1400 to 1430, the museum features a diverse collection.
name: Museo Nazionale di Villa Guinigi
address: Via della Quarquonia, 4, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Teatro del Giglio, one of Italy's oldest public theaters, is a historic and elegant venue located in Lucca. It has hosted world-class singers, musicians, and dancers over the years. Notably, Chet Baker held several concerts there and was honored with a concert organized by his jazz friends upon his release from prison. The theater also hosts the Winter Festival concerts featuring renowned songwriters like Fossati, De Gregori, and Marianne Faithfull.
name: Teatro del Giglio
address: Piazza del Giglio, 13/15, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Arched neoclassical gate built in the early 19th century with panoramic views over the old town.
detail_description: Porta Elisa is an arched neoclassical gate that was constructed in the early 19th century and offers panoramic views of the old town. It serves as one of the main entrances to the walled city of Lucca, where visitors can explore a variety of shops, restaurants, bars, and historical sites. The area around Porta Elisa provides convenient parking options and access to public transportation.
name: Porta Elisa
address: Via Elisa, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Porta di San Gervasio, dating back to the 13th century, is a well-preserved ancient city gate offering a great view of the surrounding area. While it can be quite loud at night, its historical charm and proximity to a great pizza place make it an attractive destination for visitors. The old city around Porta di San Gervasio is known for its cleanliness and beauty, making it a lovely place to explore.
name: Porta di San Gervasio
address: Via Santa Croce, 90, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Porta San Pietro is one of the main entrances to Lucca's historic center, just a short walk from the train station. It provides easy access to the old city and its 99 churches within the walls. Visitors can climb the tower for panoramic views and explore a beautiful roof garden. The area also hosts events like the world's second-largest comics and gaming event.
name: Porta San Pietro
address: Sortita Porta S. Pietro, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Forno a vapore Amedeo Giusti, established in 1830, is a renowned steam bakery that offers an array of delectable savory and sweet creations. The inviting display window beckons passersby to explore the wide variety of breads available, from simple Italian ingredients crafted into an assortment of types and sizes. The bakery's tradition and expertise result in irresistible products known for their taste, lightness, and goodness.
name: Forno a vapore Amedeo Giusti
address: Via Santa Lucia, 20, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: House-specialty focaccia & crepes, plus an array of pizzas, at a century-old, family-run spot.
detail_description: Pizzeria da Felice is a century-old, family-run pizzeria located in the charming street of via Buia, just around the corner from the church of San Michele. It's a beloved spot among locals and travelers alike, known for its house-specialty focaccia, crepes, and an array of pizzas available for take-out or by the slice. The pizzeria has mastered the art of pizza-making and has become a staple in the community.
name: Pizzeria da Felice
address: Via Buia, 12, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Sortie San Paolino (Under the walls) is a fascinating spot in Lucca, Italy. The Church Chiesa di San Frediano, dating back to the 12th century, stands out with its remarkable mosaic depicting the Ascension of Christ. Visitors can explore the interior of this ancient church. Additionally, it's interesting to note how the city utilizes its walls as passages. This unique location offers a fun and exciting walk with intriguing art displays that are definitely worth experiencing.
name: Sortie San Paolino (Under the walls)
address: Via Pallone, 2, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Scultura Ilaria del Carretto is a stunning funerary monument created by the sculptor Jacopo della Quercia between 1406 and 1408. It was commissioned by Paolo Guinigi in memory of his late wife, Ilaria del Carretto. The sculpture, located in the Cathedral of San Martino in Lucca, depicts Ilaria in her bridal attire with a faithful dog at her feet.
name: Scultura Ilaria del Carretto
address: Piazza Antelminelli, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Stately lodging overlooking Piazza San Michele, offering elegant quarters & a refined guest lounge.
detail_description: Palazzo Rocchi Hotel is a luxurious 4-star lodging located in the heart of Lucca's historic center, offering elegant rooms with stunning views of Piazza San Michele. The hotel features spacious accommodations adorned with frescoes and natural light, providing a unique blend of style and comfort. Guests can enjoy the refined guest lounge and convenient access to nearby attractions such as Lucca Train Station and the historic town of Pisa.
name: Palazzo Rocchi Hotel
address: P.za San Michele, 30, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Campo Balilla, Padiglione Carducci, Lucca Comics & Games is a renowned event that takes place at the end of October in Lucca, Italy. It is Europe's largest comics festival and attracts thousands of enthusiasts dressed as their favorite characters. The city becomes bustling with street vendors and activities for three days. This year marks the 50th anniversary of the event, which takes place against the picturesque backdrop of Lucca's walls.
name: Campo Balilla, Padiglione Carducci, Lucca Comics & Games
address: Viale Giosuè Carducci, 187, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: The Lucca Summer Festival, held annually in July, is a vibrant celebration that transforms the historic city of Lucca into a musical paradise for over a month. This festival showcases an eclectic mix of genres including classical, jazz, world music, and pop within the city's picturesque courtyards and squares. Attendees can enjoy performances from globally renowned artists like Paul McCartney and Celine Dion while soaking in the rich culture and stunning architecture of Lucca.
name: Lucca Summer Festival - Piazza Napoleone
address: P.za Napoleone, 32, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

name: Traversa 9ª Viale Giacomo Puccini
address: 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

excerpt: Elaborately adorned 14th-century tower (56 meters at its tallest point) with a world-famous lean.
detail_description: The Tower of Pisa, also known as Torre Pendente di Pisa, is a stunning 14th-century structure in Italy that has gained worldwide fame for its distinctive lean. The tower originally leaned at a dramatic angle of 5.5 degrees but extensive restoration work has reduced the lean to less than 4.0 degrees.
name: Tower of Pisa
address: Piazza del Duomo, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Large medieval baptistery praised for its acoustics, with panels by renowned sculptor Pisano.
detail_description: Located in the Square of Miracles, Battistero di San Giovanni is a stunning medieval baptistery that often goes unnoticed next to its towering neighbors. This round building boasts an impressive interior with a baptism font at its center and offers a unique vantage point from its top floor overlooking the cathedral. Constructed in the 12th century in Romanesque style, it features Gothic and Renaissance influences as well.
name: Battistero di San Giovanni
address: Piazza del Duomo, 23, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Elegant cemetery for famous Pisans set around a cloistered quadrangle with restored 1300s frescoes.
detail_description: Camposanto Monumentale, also known as the Monumental Cemetery of Pisa, is a stunning site located in Miracle Square. This elegant cemetery was built to house the graves of noble and illustrious citizens and features a rectangular gallery adorned with Roman sarcophagi and beautiful frescoes by renowned artists such as Taddeo Gaddi, Spinello Aretino, and Benozzo Gozzoli.
name: Camposanto
address: Piazza del Duomo, 17, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: 1300s building housing restored frescos & their preparatory outlines, relocated from a cemetery.
detail_description: The Sinopie Museum, located in a 1300s building, offers a unique glimpse into the creation of the famous frescoes from the Camposanto Cemetery. It houses restored frescos and their preparatory outlines, showcasing original sketches used in their designs. The museum provides an intriguing behind-the-scenes look at the 14th-century frescoes by displaying the rough initial drawings created with a dark reddish-brown pigment known as sinopia during the Renaissance.
name: Sinopie Museum
address: Piazza del Duomo, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy

excerpt: Museum exhibiting ornate ceremonial objects & works of religious art from the adjacent cathedral.
detail_description: The Museo della Cattedrale, located near the stunning cathedral of Lucca, is a treasure trove of religious art and history. Since 1992, it has housed the furnishing works of the Cathedral of San Martino in chronological order, offering visitors a glimpse into historical changes. The museum's collection includes ornate ceremonial objects, intricate silverwork, ancient manuscripts, magnificent sculptures, and even jewelry and carpets. One room is dedicated to the Holy Face preserved in the cathedral.
name: Museo della Cattedrale
address: Piazza Antelminelli, 5, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Fattoria Al Dotto Lucca is a renowned winery nestled in the picturesque countryside of Lucca, Italy. This family-owned estate is celebrated for its adherence to traditional winemaking methods and its exceptional wine selection. Visitors are invited to immerse themselves in the beauty of the lush vineyards, explore historic cellars, and indulge in tastings within elegant rooms. The experience offers a true taste of Tuscany, combining rich wine heritage with warm hospitality and breathtaking landscapes.
name: Fattoria Al Dotto Lucca
address: Via per Carignano, 809A, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: Cioccolateria Caniparoli, located on Via San Paolino in Lucca, Italy, is a paradise for chocolate lovers. The artisan chocolates are not only visually stunning but also incredibly delicious. The dedication to quality is evident as the shop closes between June and August to maintain the chocolates' integrity in the heat. Visitors rave about the friendly service and exceptional gelato at this must-visit chocolate shop.
name: Cioccolateria Caniparoli
address: Via S. Paolino, 44, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: The church of Santa Maria della Rosa in Lucca, Italy was once the home of the Templars. The building is now home to the Equestrian Order of the Holy Sepulchre.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria della Rosa
address: Via della Rosa, 25, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

name: Chiesa Santa Maria Corteorlandini
address: Via Santa Maria Corteorlandini, 10A, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: The Church of Saint Mary Foris Portam known as the Church of the White Madonna is diametrically opposed to the church containing in fact the copy of the Madonna of Loreto, known as the Black Madonna. Both churches are related to the Templars.
name: Chiesa di Santa Maria Foris Portam
address: Piazza Santa Maria Foris Portam, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: "Puccini e la sua Lucca" is a captivating event that celebrates the legacy of the renowned composer Giacomo Puccini in the enchanting setting of San Giovanni church. This experience, which unfolds nightly at 7:15 PM, features an hour-long concert that immerses attendees in the beauty of opera amidst stunning historical surroundings. The church itself offers fascinating glimpses into its Roman past with mosaics and ancient foundations, making it a treasure trove for history enthusiasts.
name: Puccini e la sua Lucca
address: Via Duomo, 5, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

detail_description: The Chiesa dei Santi Giovanni e Reparata offers a glimpse into the distant past, with an open excavated area beneath the church revealing remains of a Paleochristian church and Roman structures dating back to 180 BC. The site provides a peaceful atmosphere and is not overly adorned, making it perfect for those interested in archaeology. Visitors can explore remnants of a Roman bath, an 8th-century baptistery, and a 5th-century mosaic below the church.
name: Chiesa dei Santi Giovanni e Reparata
address: Piazza S. Giovanni, 55100 Lucca LU, Italy

name: Acquedotto Nottolini （South)
address: Via S. Quirico, 32, 55060 Capannori LU, Italy
